newsitem.title: MALAWI: SOCCER-NKHWAZI GOAL DENIES TANZANIA RARE WIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-NKHWAZI GOAL DENIES TANZANIA RARE WIN.

text.p: Malawian striker Jones Nkhwazi denied Tanzania a rare away victory with a second-half equaliser as the two countries drew 2-2 in the Cosafa Castle Cup on Saturday.
But Nkhwazi's goal was not enough to stop Malawi finishing bottom in the five-nation tournament for countries in the southern African region.
Tanzania, who had not won an away international in eight years, hit the woodwork twice and scored the opening goal in a furious onslaught in the first 10 minutes through Idelphonce Amlima.
Lovemore Fazili levelled after 19 minutes but Tanzania's midfield superiority and more creative play paid off two minutes from halftime when Amlima crossed for Victor Bambo to score.
Amlima then had a shot cleared off the line by Malawian captain Patric Mabedi early in the second-half with the goalkeeper well beaten.

Nkhwazi, one of few Malawian players to impress the 20,000 crowd at the Civo stadium, equalised for the second time when he got in front of Tanzanian goalkeeper Riffat Saidi and forced home a driving header in the 72nd minute.
The draw saw Tanzania finish fourth in the table with three points from their four matches.
Namibia host Zambia in the final match of the new annual competition on August 31 with the home team needing a win and Zambia just a draw to take the trophy and win almost $100,000 in prize money.
